title: Nissan recruitment drive and hundreds of jobs up for grabs in North East
text:
Nissan recruitment drive and hundreds of jobs up for grabs in North East New work opportunities revealed as latest figures reveal jobless total in North East has flatlined Share Two millionth Nissan Qashqai on the production line in Sunderland Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Hundreds of jobs are up for grabs in the North East which includes an ongoing recruitment drive at Nissan. 
The Japanese carmakers, which employs around 7,000 staff at its Sunderland plants , has taken on great symbolic importance after the EU referendum result . 
It was thought a Brexit vote might force it to slash investment in the North East as it could cut it off from European markets. 
However a secret deal last year in which the government is believed to have offered it support has seemingly persuaded bosses they should stay. 
Its recruitment drive was outlined by Steve McCall of Jobcentre Plus Northumberland Tyne and Wear today as the latest quarterly employment figures were revealed. 
He revealed Nissan is regularly interviewing for new staff, taking on around 15 people a month to work in its factory or its supply chain. 
“They go on a two work training course which gives them an insight into the work and Nissan want to continue working with Jobcentre Plus throughout 2017.” Damian Hinds, employment minister 
Meanwhile the North East unemployment rate has flatlined at 6.8% - but is still the highest in the rest of the UK with an average of 4.8%. The jobless total in this region for the three months to November was 87,000. 
The amount of people in work is 1.2m, down 13,000 on the previous quarter, though up 4,000 for the same September to November period for 2015. 
Mr McCall said: “The employment rate is a bit bumpy this time of year so we look at the year-on-year figure which shows employment is up.” 
He said Nissan was among a number of recruitment drives in the region in the New Year. 
Mr McCall said: “Go North East is looking to recruit 250 drivers. 
“We are working closely with Bourne Leisure who own Haggerston Castle Holiday Park near Berwick who are recruiting across a range of job roles, including bar staff, waiting staff, kitchen porters, sport assistants, lifeguards, chefs, Lifeguards and Sports Assistants. On offer is 10 months of work.”

“We also expect recruitment to start soon for Parkdean Holidays with parks at Cresswell Towers, Sandy Bay, Newbiggin and Whitley Bay. These jobs aren’t yet on their website. 
“And Alnwick Castle and Gardens are also recruiting for the 2017 season.”
